p: A novel influenza virus, recently classified as the influenza D virus, has been identified in several animals, such as swine, cattle and sheep from across the globe. IDVs are the latest member in the family Orthomyxoviridae with the potential of zoonotic and interspecies transmission. In this review, we have summarized the epidemiology, pathology, evolution and molecular biology of the novel influenza D virus that represents a potential threat to public health.
